prompt: <description>Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. **Part 1** 1. **Create a new coordinate system:** - Set the Euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) - Set the translation vector to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) 2. **Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system:** (face_1) 3. **Draw the following lines to create a polygon shape:** (loop_1) - Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.1442), End Point (0.0288, 0.1442) - Line 2: Start Point (0.0288, 0.1442), End Point (0.0288, 0.0) - Line 3: Start Point (0.0288, 0.0), End Point (0.7212, 0.0) - Line 4: Start Point (0.7212, 0.0), End Point (0.7212, 0.1442) - Line 5: Start Point (0.7212, 0.1442), End Point (0.75, 0.1442) - Line 6: Start Point (0.75, 0.1442), End Point (0.75, 0.2019) - Line 7: Start Point (0.75, 0.2019), End Point (0.7212, 0.2019) - Line 8: Start Point (0.7212, 0.2019), End Point (0.7212, 0.3462) - Line 9: Start Point (0.7212, 0.3462), End Point (0.0288, 0.3462) - Line 10: Start Point (0.0288, 0.3462), End Point (0.0288, 0.2019) - Line 11: Start Point (0.0288, 0.2019), End Point (0.0, 0.2019) - Line 12: Start Point (0.0, 0.2019), End Point (0.0, 0.1442) The loop consists of 12 lines, forming a polygon with slightly tapered middle section. 4. **Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75:** 5. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system:** 6. **Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.0288 units towards the normal direction:** - The resulting CAD part is a rectangular prism with the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.0288 units</description>
completion:
<json>

</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with Euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. This will serve as the base for the first part of the CAD model. Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the aforementioned coordinate system. The sketch should have a rectangular shape with parallel sides and right angles, with a slightly tapered shape narrowing towards the top. Step 3: Define the curves of the sketch * Define an arc (arc\\_1) with the following points: + Start Point: [0.0, 0.0312] + Mid Point: [0.0092, 0.0092] + End Point: [0.0312, 0.0] * Define a line (line\\_1) with the following points: + Start Point: [0.0312, 0.0] + End Point: [0.7188, 0.0] * Define an arc (arc\\_2) with the following points: + Start Point: [0.7188, 0.0] + Mid Point: [0.7408, 0.0092] + End Point: [0.75, 0.0312] * Define a line (line\\_2) with the following points: + Start Point: [0.75, 0.0312] + End Point: [0.75, 0.6875] * Define an arc (arc\\_3) with the following points: + Start Point: [0.75, 0.6875] + Mid Point: [0.7408, 0.7096] + End Point: [0.7188, 0.7188] * Define a line (line\\_3) with the following points: + Start Point: [0.7188, 0.7188] + End Point: [0.0312, 0.7188] * Define an arc (arc\\_4) with the following points: + Start Point: [0.0312, 0.7188] + Mid Point: [0.0092, 0.7096] + End Point: [0.0, 0.6875] * Define a line (line\\_4) with the following points: + Start Point: [0.0, 0.6875] + End Point: [0.0, 0.0312] Step 4: Close the loop of the sketch The sketch consists of one loop containing four arcs and four lines. Ensure that the loop is closed by connecting the start and end points of the sketch. The loop should have a combined length of approximately 0.75 units and a height of approximately 0.0937 units. Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.0937 units and in the opposite direction of normals by 0.0 units. Apply a sketch scale of 0.75 to the sketch during the extrusion process. This will create a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, narrowing towards the top, and with a slightly tapered shape. The final dimensions of this part are as follows: * Length: 0.75 units * Width: 0.75 units * Height: 0.0937 units The first part of the CAD model is now complete. The subsequent parts will be constructed in a similar manner, building upon the previously constructed parts using the operation defined for that part. All intermediate parts combine to form the final CAD model.</description>

The sketch should have four faces (face\\_1 to face\\_4) and each face should have one loop. **Face 1** Loop 1 (4 lines) Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.5357], End Point [0.0402, 0.0] Line 2: Start Point [0.0402, 0.0], End Point [0.308, 0.0] Line 3: Start Point [0.308, 0.0], End Point [0.308, 0.5357] Line 4: Start Point [0.308, 0.5357], End Point [0.0, 0.5357] **Face 2** Loop 1 (3 lines) Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.5357], End Point [0.308, 0.5357] Line 2: Start Point [0.308, 0.5357], End Point [0.308, 0.75] Line 3: Start Point [0.308, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.5357] **Face 3** Loop 1 (4 lines) Line 1: Start Point [0.308, 0.0], End Point [0.5759, 0.0] Line 2: Start Point [0.5759, 0.0], End Point [0.6161, 0.5357] Line 3: Start Point [0.6161, 0.5357], End Point [0.308, 0.5357] Line 4: Start Point [0.308, 0.5357], End Point [0.308, 0.0] **Face 4** Loop 1 (3 lines) Line 1: Start Point [0.308, 0.5357], End Point [0.6161, 0.5357] Line 2: Start Point [0.6161, 0.5357], End Point [0.308, 0.75] Line 3: Start Point [0.308, 0.75], End Point [0.308, 0.5357] **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling factor 0.75. **Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D object** Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D object by creating an extrusion with the following parameters: Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0161 Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 Sketch scale: 0.75 Operation: **Create a new solid body**</description>

This will result in a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. **Additional Details** This part has the following dimensions: * Length: 0.75 units * Width: 0.75 units * Height: 0.1088 units The sketch contains one face, made up of a single loop with 7 line segments. [0.2354, 0.0268] 2. [0.2358, 0.0275] 3. [0.2514, 0.0881] 4. [0.2358, 0.1487] 5. [0.2354, 0.1495] 6. [0.0, 0.0881] 7. [0.2354, 0.0268] *Sketch 2: Central Hole* * Draw an ellipse centered at [0.4228, 0.0881] with the major axis of length 0.1108 and the minor axis of length 0.0812. *Sketch 3: Handle* * Draw a rectangle with the following vertices: 1. [0.0449, 0.1245] 2. [0.0538, 0.0364] 3. [0.1346, 0.0] 4. [0.2065, 0.0517] 5. [0.2028, 0.0881] 6. [0.1976, 0.1399] 7. [0.188, 0.1442] 8. [0.1168, 0.1763] 9. [0.0979, 0.1627] 10. [0.0449, 0.1245] **Step 3: Apply constraints and geometric relations** * Close the loops in each sketch. * Add constraints to ensure that all curves are tangent and/or perpendicular where they intersect. **Step 4: Scale the 2D Sketches** Scale the 2D sketches by a factor of 0.75. **Step 5: Extrude the Sketches** Extrude the scaled sketches as follows: * Sketch 1: Extrude by 0.0838 towards the normal. * Sketch 2: Cut by 0.0838 towards the normal. * Sketch 3: Extrude by 0.75 towards the normal. **Step 6: Perform Boolean Operations** Perform the required boolean operations to combine the extrusions into a single solid body, resulting in a hexagonal wrench with a central hole and a long handle. The dimensions of this part will be: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.0838 * Height: 0.75</description>
